1122938738944790528.text: Melody and I go back—to almost fifteen years ago, when I started dabbling in infovis to help Google evaluate search quality. Our goal then, as now, was to help engineers understand their impact in practice (not just theory).

1104043043164844032.text: I think we overestimate our understanding of code. Put enough “simple” code together and quickly it’s not so simple. Visualization shines a light on real behavior and guides us towards better designs.

1104038824026361858.text: Of course, you know I’m already a firm believer in the value of visualization for understanding and designing code. But I’m still delighted when it shows me something new in code I’ve been working on for years!

1104038822495449088.text: It wasn’t that the previous code was wrong; it was superficially correct. It just didn’t have the desired effect. Once visualized, these unintended effects and how to improve the code became (pretty much) obvious.
